intro: Hedyotis korrorensis, commonly known as the New Zealand germander, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along streambanks. Hedyotis korrorensis is often found in the understorey of native forests, where it plays a role in the local ecosystem.
